alert.note: Alert for Jefferson (Florida) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Severe Weather Statement issued June 16 at 3:11AM EDT until June 16 at 3:45AM EDT by NWS Tallahassee
info.description: ...A TORNADO WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 345 AM EDT FOR SOUTHWESTERN JEFFERSON AND NORTHWESTERN TAYLOR COUNTIES... At 311 AM EDT, a confirmed tornado was located 11 miles east of St. Marks, moving east at 30 mph. HAZARD...Damaging tornado. SOURCE...Radar confirmed tornado. IMPACT...Flying debris will be dangerous to those caught without shelter. Mobile homes will be damaged or destroyed. Damage to roofs, windows, and vehicles will occur. Tree damage is likely. Locations impacted include... Scanlon and Econfina. TORNADO...OBSERVED MAX HAIL SIZE...<.75 IN
info.instruction: To repeat, a tornado is on the ground. TAKE COVER NOW! Move to a basement or an interior room on the lowest floor of a sturdy building. Avoid windows. If you are outdoors, in a mobile home, or in a vehicle, move to the closest substantial shelter and protect yourself from flying debris. Tornadoes are extremely difficult to see and confirm at night. Do not wait to see or hear the tornado. TAKE COVER NOW!
